title: How to Make Rhubarb, Apple, and Pear Crisp

steps.headline: Make the fruit layer.
steps.description: Into a medium-sized glass baking dish, toss the sliced and diced rhubarb, apple, and pear. To prevent the browning of the fruits and rhubarb, squirt with 1 tablespoon of lemon juice. Sprinkle over 2 tablespoons of granulated sugar/cane sugar to taste.

steps.headline: Make the topping.
steps.description: Mix the brown sugar, butter, cinnamon, and oats in a bowl. Use your fingers to mash and combine the ingredients. Create a uniform, crumbly mixture (see the photo).

steps.headline: Sprinkle the crumble topping over the fruit and rhubarb evenly.
Place the crisp in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for about 50 minutes, or until the topping has browned.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and serve in small dishes while still hot.

text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Make the fruit layer. Into a medium-sized glass baking dish, toss the sliced and diced rhubarb, apple, and pear. To prevent the browning of the fruits and rhubarb, squirt with 1 tablespoon of lemon juice. Sprinkle over 2 tablespoons of granulated sugar/cane sugar to taste. Make the topping. Mix the brown sugar, butter, cinnamon, and oats in a bowl. Use your fingers to mash and combine the ingredients. Create a uniform, crumbly mixture (see the photo). Sprinkle the crumble topping over the fruit and rhubarb evenly.  Place the crisp in the oven. Bake for about 50 minutes, or until the topping has browned. Remove from the oven and serve in small dishes while still hot. Add cream or ice cream. Finished!
